Token.Abstract: The time in seconds to wait before attempting the first reconnect. If the MQTT client becomes disconnected, it will attempt to reconnect after a quiet period; this quiet period doubles with each failed connection attempt, e.g. 1 second, 2 seconds, 4, 8, 16, 32, etc... up until a maximum reconnection time (maximumReconnectTimeInterval) is reached. If a connection is active for the minimum connection time (minimumConnectionTimeInterval), the quiet period is reset to the initial value. Default value: 1 second.

The time in seconds to wait before attempting the first reconnect. If the MQTT client becomes disconnected, it will attempt to reconnect after a quiet period; this quiet period doubles with each failed connection attempt, e.g. 1 second, 2 seconds, 4, 8, 16, 32, etc... up until a maximum reconnection time (maximumReconnectTimeInterval) is reached. If a connection is active for the minimum connection time (minimumConnectionTimeInterval), the quiet period is reset to the initial value. Default value: 1 second.

The time in seconds to wait before attempting the first reconnect. If the MQTT client becomes disconnected, it will attempt to reconnect after a quiet period; this quiet period doubles with each failed connection attempt, e.g. 1 second, 2 seconds, 4, 8, 16, 32, etc... up until a maximum reconnection time (maximumReconnectTimeInterval) is reached. If a connection is active for the minimum connection time (minimumConnectionTimeInterval), the quiet period is reset to the initial value. Default value: 1 second.
The time in seconds that a connection must be active before resetting the current reconnection time to the base reconnection time. Default value: 20 seconds.
The time in seconds that a connection must be active before resetting the current reconnection time to the base reconnection time. Default value: 20 seconds.
The time in seconds that a connection must be active before resetting the current reconnection time to the base reconnection time. Default value: 20 seconds.
The maximum time in seconds to wait prior to attempting to reconnect. Default value: 128 seconds.
The maximum time in seconds to wait prior to attempting to reconnect. Default value: 128 seconds.
The maximum time in seconds to wait prior to attempting to reconnect. Default value: 128 seconds.
The MQTT keep-alive time in seconds. Default value: 60s seconds.
The MQTT keep-alive time in seconds. Default value: 60s seconds.
The MQTT keep-alive time in seconds. Default value: 60s seconds.

The last will and testament (LWT) to be used when connecting to AWS IoT; in the event that this client disconnects improperly, AWS IoT will use this to notify any interested clients. Default value: nil

The last will and testament (LWT) to be used when connecting to AWS IoT; in the event that this client disconnects improperly, AWS IoT will use this to notify any interested clients. Default value: nil

The last will and testament (LWT) to be used when connecting to AWS IoT; in the event that this client disconnects improperly, AWS IoT will use this to notify any interested clients. Default value: nil
The run loop to execute the MQTT client in. Default value: [NSRunLoop currentRunLoop]
The run loop to execute the MQTT client in. Default value: [NSRunLoop currentRunLoop]
The run loop to execute the MQTT client in. Default value: [NSRunLoop currentRunLoop]
The run loop mode to use when executing the MQTT client. Default value: NSDefaultRunLoopMode
The run loop mode to use when executing the MQTT client. Default value: NSDefaultRunLoopMode
The run loop mode to use when executing the MQTT client. Default value: NSDefaultRunLoopMode

Boolean flag to indicate whether auto-resubscribe feature is enabled. Default value: YES When enabled, in the event of abnormal network disconnection, the sdk automatically subscribes to previously subscribed topics.

Boolean flag to indicate whether auto-resubscribe feature is enabled. Default value: YES When enabled, in the event of abnormal network disconnection, the sdk automatically subscribes to previously subscribed topics.

Boolean flag to indicate whether auto-resubscribe feature is enabled. Default value: YES When enabled, in the event of abnormal network disconnection, the sdk automatically subscribes to previously subscribed topics.
The max number of publish messages to retry per second if the pub-ack is not received within 60 seconds *
The max number of publish messages to retry per second if the pub-ack is not received within 60 seconds *
The max number of publish messages to retry per second if the pub-ack is not received within 60 seconds *

Create an AWSIoTMQTTConfiguration object and initialize its parameters. The AWSIoTMQTTConfiguration object is then passed to AWSIoTDataManager to initialize it. Note, clients need to either specify all parameters explicitly or not customize any parameter in which case default parameter values will be used to initialize AWSIoTMqttConfiguration.

Parameter.Name: kat
Parameter.Abstract: keepAliveTimeInterval, Mqtt Keep Alive time in seconds

Parameter.Name: brt
Parameter.Abstract: baseReconnectTimeInterval, The time in seconds to wait before attempting the first reconnect

Parameter.Name: mct
Parameter.Abstract: minimumConnectionTimeInterval, The time in seconds that a connection must be active before resetting the current reconnection time to the base reconnection time.

Parameter.Name: mrt
Parameter.Abstract: maximumReconnectTimeInterval, The maximum time in seconds to wait prior to attempting to reconnect

Parameter.Name: rlp
Parameter.Abstract: The run loop to execute the MQTT client in

Parameter.Name: rlm
Parameter.Abstract: The run loop mode to use when executing the MQTT client

Parameter.Name: ars
Parameter.Abstract: autoResubscribe, Boolean flag to indicate whether auto-resubscribe feature is enabled

Parameter.Name: lwt
Parameter.Abstract: lastWillAndTestament, The last will and testament (LWT) to be used when connecting to AWS IoT

Token.Abstract: Create an AWSIoTMQTTConfiguration object and initialize its parameters. The AWSIoTMQTTConfiguration object is then passed to AWSIoTDataManager to initialize it. Note, clients need to either specify all parameters explicitly or not customize any parameter in which case default parameter values will be used to initialize AWSIoTMqttConfiguration.

Parameter.Name: kat
Parameter.Abstract: keepAliveTimeInterval, Mqtt Keep Alive time in seconds

Parameter.Name: brt
Parameter.Abstract: baseReconnectTimeInterval, The time in seconds to wait before attempting the first reconnect

Parameter.Name: mct
Parameter.Abstract: minimumConnectionTimeInterval, The time in seconds that a connection must be active before resetting the current reconnection time to the base reconnection time.

Parameter.Name: mrt
Parameter.Abstract: maximumReconnectTimeInterval, The maximum time in seconds to wait prior to attempting to reconnect

Parameter.Name: rlp
Parameter.Abstract: The run loop to execute the MQTT client in

Parameter.Name: rlm
Parameter.Abstract: The run loop mode to use when executing the MQTT client

Parameter.Name: ars
Parameter.Abstract: autoResubscribe, Boolean flag to indicate whether auto-resubscribe feature is enabled

Parameter.Name: lwt
Parameter.Abstract: lastWillAndTestament, The last will and testament (LWT) to be used when connecting to AWS IoT

Parameter.Name: prt
Parameter.Abstract: publishRetryThrottle, the max number of publish messages to retry per second if the pub-ack is not received within 60 seconds
